text: Boana beckeri is a frog that lives in Brazil in Minas Gerais. It lives in at least one protected place: the Parque Estadual Nova Baden. Humans are more likely to see this frog on rainy days. The male frog climbs onto low plants and sings for the female frogs. This frog's Latin name comes from scientist Johann Becker. ==References== Category:Frogs of South America
title: Boana beckeri
